docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Gibson Jr., an American Airlines vice president, unexpectedly became a Deputy Mayor of New York City last week--the third black man to be offered the job after the first two withdrew--and when he was asked how he felt about being a third choice, he overcame the awkward situation with the comment, "Three out of eight million's not a bad figure."

headline.main: The Region; What New York Thinks

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Energy Office released details of a proposed gasoline rationing plan today while making public formal allocations of fuels that favor public services and industrial use at the expense of private automobiles and home heating. John C. Sawhill, deputy energy chief, discussing fuel needs yesterday.

headline.main: U.S. ISSUES RULES ON ALLOTTING FUEL; Public Services and Industry Uses Favored-Stand-By Gasoline Plan Released U.S. Issues Rules on Allocation of Fuel 2 Classes of Drivers Reserve for States More for Cargo Haulers Reserve for States More for Cargo Haulers Is That All Clear Now?

docs.abstract: Fed Energy Office new rules for allocation of fuel favor mass transit systems and trucks at expense of private autos; transit systems will receive 100% of their current fuel requirements
